wikipedia_page.main:
Harold Alfred Denham (13 October 1872 – 25 February 1946) was a British Army officer and an English first-class cricketer. Denham was a right-handed batsman.
Denham represented Hampshire in one first-class match in 1896 against Sussex.
He was commissioned as a second lieutenant in the King's (Liverpool Regiment) on 21 October 1893, promoted to lieutenant on 18 July 1896, and to captain on 21 March 1900. He saw active service in South Africa during the Second Boer War in 1901, and did not leave that colony until after the end of the war the following year, arriving home with the SS Walmer Castle in November 1902.Denham died in Wilmington, Sussex on 25 February 1946.
